title: EU agrees to open Ukraine and Moldova accession talks after Orban abstains
summary: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who had repeatedly threatened to veto the talks, agreed to abstain on the consensus decision made by the other 26 EU leaders. Georgia was also granted formal candidate status.

title: Denmark and Germany arrest Hamas suspects planning attacks in Europe
summary: Four individuals were reportedly detained in Germany and the Netherlands on suspicion of plotting attacks on Jewish institutions across Europe. Three others were arrested in Denmark on separate terrorism charges.

title: Putin shows his confidence in Ukraine: 'The solution will be negotiated or achieved by force'
summary: For almost four hours, in front of journalists and citizens gathered in Moscow, Putin assured that his war aims had not changed. He also portrayed a Russia ready for a long confrontation with the West.

title: Washington urges Israel to scale down its war in Gaza
summary: Israel's defense minister said Thursday it will take 'several months' to 'destroy' Hamas, foreseeing a prolonged conflict. This comes as Israel and its key ally, the United States, face mounting international isolation due to the devastation in Gaza.

title: 'Caught between Trump and Putin, Europe is heading for disaster, like the sleepwalkers of 1914'
summary: The European Council summit on December 14 and 15 is shaping up to be a dangerous one, for both Ukraine and Europe's future. The time has come for unorthodox initiatives, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: The Christophe Galtier scandal: Three questions about Ramadan in football
summary: The football manager is on trial in Nice on Friday for harassment and discrimination during his time with the local club. He is accused of stigmatizing Muslim players during their fasting period, which he denies.

title: Presidents of Venezuela and Guyana meet to defuse tensions over oil-rich region
summary: Guyanese President Irfaan Ali emerged from the talks adamant that 'Guyana has all the right... to facilitate any investment, any partnership... in our sovereign space.'

title: US Congress passes colossal 2024 defense budget
summary: The vast $886 billion defense budget bill includes measures to counter China in the Indo-Pacific, some military aid for Ukraine, a 5% pay rise for military personnel, and extends a controversial overseas surveillance tool.

title: Between Biden and Netanyahu, an increasingly uncomfortable alliance
summary: Benjamin Netanyahu is adamantly opposed to Washington's post-war plans for Gaza, while Joe Biden has just publicly denounced for the first time the Israeli army's 'indiscriminate bombing' of the Palestinian territory.

title: Air France employees strike against ending operations at Orly airport
summary: The Air France workers' union strike, launched on December 14 to protest against the airline's decision to leave Paris-Orly airport, will hit around one in three flights at Orly on December 18, as well as flights in Brest.

title: COP28: Is the agreement 'historic' or an 'empty shell'?
summary: Some scientists see the Global Stocktake, the text calling for 'transitioning away' from fossil fuels, as a positive development, but others point out that it is non-binding and lacks the support of emerging countries.

title: 'Barbie' director Greta Gerwig to preside 2024 Cannes Film Festival jury
summary: The 40-year-old is the first American woman filmmaker to take on the role, and the youngest jury president since 1966.

title: Paris 2024: Ukraine's athletes prepare for the Olympic Games amid war
summary: Many athletes have continued to train in their home country, despite the Russian invasion.

title: Christine Lagarde, the central banker who's mastered politics
summary: The International Monetary Fund has opened an internal audit into the biggest loan in its history, granted to Argentina in 2018, when Christine Lagarde was in charge. Now halfway through her term at the European Central Bank, the Frenchwoman has built her career on a mastery of political equilibriums.

title: European Union reaches deal to reform electricity market
summary: Members states and the European Parliament found a deal on Thursday to stabilize prices and favor investment in decarbonated energy.

title: Paris: Petition against Serge Gainsbourg metro stop gathers pace
summary: More than 10,000 people have signed a petition to stop a Paris metro station being named after the French singer, arguing he was 'violent towards women' and a 'pedo-criminal.'

title: Austria and Hungary on the offensive at EU summit in push for Western Balkans entry
summary: European heads of state and government will have to take a stand on enlargement in the region over the next few days.

title: 'The Three Musketeers: Milady': Epic fights around an intriguing and deadly female lead
summary: The second installment of the swashbuckling adventure saga struggles to break new ground and fails to carve out a strong presence for its female lead, played by Eva Green.

title: Colombia becomes the first major nation to join the fossil fuel non-proliferation coalition
summary: In power since August 2022, left-wing President Gustavo Petro wants to set his country on the path toward an ambitious energy transition.

title: Spanish parents are rallying to ban cell phones for children under 16
summary: A series of incidents linked to schoolchildren's social media usage and parental efforts to curb unrestricted smartphone access have sparked a major national debate on the issue.

title: Israel's use of AI in bombings raises questions over rules of war
summary: The number of victims and the unprecedented scale of the damage caused by the Israeli military's bombardment of Gaza have reignited the debate on the use of artificial intelligence in weapons systems.

title: COP28: Sultan al-Jaber, the unlikely hand behind the 'historic' agreement
summary: Al-Jaber's dual role of being the president of COP28 and the CEO of the Emirates National Oil Company proved an asset when it came to achieving consensus during negotiations.

title: 'The Crown,' season six, part two: Netflix's moving farewell to the Queen
summary: After four unconvincing episodes devoted to the disappearance of Princess Diana, Peter Morgan's series admirably raises the bar for its final episodes.
